subject: Jordans For Sale
body: Hey, you've won free Jordans from our giveaway! All you have to do is put in a small deposit as our system doesn't allow us to mail things for free and they're all yours. Respond within 1 day to claim your reward!
explanation: This is a scam email: Shoes are sold by reputable brands, and asking for a deposit is a red flag.

subject: Urgent: Your Bank Account Is Compromised
body: Dear Customer, we’ve detected unusual activity on your bank account. Click the link below to verify your credentials immediately, or your account will be suspended.
explanation: This is a scam email: Legitimate banks never use such urgent language or unverified links.

subject: You've Been Selected For A Government Grant
body: Congratulations! You've been selected to receive a $5,000 government relief grant. Provide your bank details and a small fee to claim.
explanation: This is a scam email: Government grants don't require fees and are not awarded randomly.

subject: Action Required: Confirm Your New Account Details
body: We have updated our security policy. Confirm your account details by clicking the secure link below.
explanation: This is a scam email: Official updates rarely ask for confirmation via email links.

subject: Urgent: Update Your Payment Information Now
body: Your account has been flagged due to outdated payment information. Update now to avoid service interruption.
explanation: This is a scam email: Banks generally do not send such urgent notices via email.

subject: Exclusive Deal: 50% Off on All Electronics
body: Hurry! Limited time offer on all electronics. Shop now and enjoy 50% off.
explanation: This email could be a scam: Overly aggressive discount offers may be used to lure customers to fraudulent sites.

subject: Alert: Unusual Activity Detected on Your Social Media Account
body: We've noticed unusual sign-in attempts on your account. Verify your identity using the link below.
explanation: This is a scam email: Legitimate social networks will direct you to log in via their official app or website.

subject: Invitation: Join Our Exclusive VIP Members Club!
body: You've been selected for our VIP members club. Join now for free and enjoy exclusive benefits.
explanation: This is a scam email: Unsolicited VIP offers are often used to capture personal details.

subject: Your Order #45892 Has Shipped
body: Hi there! Your order #45892 has been shipped. Track your parcel using the link provided.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: It reflects a standard e-commerce transaction.

subject: Reminder: Your Subscription Renewal is Due
body: Your monthly subscription is due for renewal. Log in to your account to confirm or change your plan.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: It is a routine subscription reminder.

subject: Weekly Newsletter - Tech Trends & Updates
body: Here’s your weekly roundup of tech news: AI in healthcare, foldable devices, and next-gen processors.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: It's sent by a known tech news source and offers updates you subscribed for.

subject: Invoice #8723 from Reliable Utilities
body: Please find attached your invoice for this month's utilities. Thank you for your prompt payment.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: It correctly follows a billing format from a professional utility service.

subject: Receipt for Your Recent Purchase
body: Thank you for your purchase. Attached is your digital receipt. Contact support if needed.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: Receipt details are consistent with e-commerce transactions.

subject: Your Appointment Confirmation from HealthCare Plus
body: This is a reminder for your appointment. Reply if you need to reschedule.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: Appointment confirmations are standard for healthcare providers.

subject: Schedule Your Annual Benefits Enrollment
body: It’s time for your annual benefits enrollment. Review and select your options before the deadline.
explanation: This is a legitimate email: HR-related communications are consistent and routine.

subject: Limited Time Offer: Free Software Update
body: Upgrade your software for free! Click here to download the latest update.
explanation: This may be a scam email: Free updates could be used to distribute malware. Always verify at the official site.

subject: Security Alert: Multiple Login Attempts
body: We detected multiple login attempts on your account. Please verify your identity immediately.
explanation: This email could be a scam: While security alerts are common, verify through official channels rather than links in email.

subject: Confirm Your Email to Activate Your New Service
body: Welcome! Confirm your email address by clicking the link to activate your service.
explanation: This could be a phishing scam: Confirmation emails should be verified before clicking unfamiliar links.

subject: New Message Notification from Your Friend
body: You have a new message waiting from a friend. Click here to view the conversation.
explanation: This email may be legitimate if you use the service, but sometimes scammers mimic notifications.

subject: Survey Invitation: Help Us Improve Our Service
body: We value your input! Complete our short survey to help us improve our service.
explanation: While this can be legitimate, such survey invitations can also be phishing attempts. Verify the sender if unsure.

subject: Account Update Notification
body: Due to recent security updates, we require all customers to review their account details. Please log in to confirm your transactions.
explanation: This email is ambiguous: It mimics bank communications, but legitimate banks use secure channels. Verify independently.

subject: Important: Verify Your Account Information
body: There have been changes to your account policies. Verify your personal information to avoid service interruptions.
explanation: This email is ambiguous: The sender’s address is slightly off. Always contact your bank via official means.

subject: Your Account Has Been Upgraded
body: Your account has been upgraded to premium status. Enjoy enhanced features with your new membership.
explanation: This email is tricky: It could be genuine or spoofed. Confirm with your provider if you were expecting an upgrade.

subject: New Activity on Your Account
body: We detected unusual activity on your account. If you did not authorize this, please contact support immediately.
explanation: This email is upfront: There are no links.

subject: Action Needed: Confirm Your Account Change
body: A recent change was made to your account settings. If you did not initiate this change, secure your account immediately.
explanation: This email is challenging: It prompts immediate action, a common tactic in phishing attempts.

subject: Subscription Renewal Notice
body: Your subscription is up for renewal. Visit our website to manage your subscription and update your payment details.
explanation: This email is subtle: It looks like a standard renewal notice, but verify the website URL for authenticity.

subject: Update Required: Verify Your Device Settings
body: Please update your device settings by clicking the secure link to ensure optimal performance.
explanation: This email is ambiguous: While device updates are common, scammers may use similar tactics to distribute malware.

subject: Notice: Policy Changes on Your Account
body: Review our updated privacy policy and confirm your acceptance by logging into your account.
explanation: This is ambiguous: Policy change notices can be legitimate but are also used in phishing. Verify by navigating directly to the site.

subject: Verification Required: Suspicious Activity Detected
body: We noticed some activity that doesn't match your usual patterns. Verify your identity to secure your account.
explanation: This email is subtle: It could be a genuine security alert or a sophisticated phishing attempt. Verify through official channels.

subject: Service Interruption Notice
body: Due to maintenance, your service might experience intermittent issues. No action is required at this time.
explanation: This email is ambiguous: It appears routine, but always contact support if you suspect foul play.
